page.title: 07The Glenisla Games.
page.content: The Glenisla Games began in 1856. They are always held in the Haugh of Fortar on a Friday in August. Glenisla school pupils have a day off school and most of them attend the Games. Although it is a small Highland Gathering many people travel some distance to attend. It is a happy occasion when locals and visitors alike have the chance to get together and socialise. The events which are held include tossing the caber,hammer throwing,piping,Highland Dancing and Cumberland Wrestling. There are stalls selling home-made sweets,baking etc. A marquee is set up in which food and drink are served. At the close of the games teams compete in tug o'war and a race to the top of Mount Blair is held. In the evening a dance is held in the local hall to round off the day.
